brief_title: Investigational Drug Versus an Approved Drug in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis (0663-072)
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety of an investigational drug versus an approved drug for the relief of pain in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
detailed_description: The duration of treatment is 12 months.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - Males and females 50 years or older with rheumatoid arthritis. Exclusion Criteria: - History of gastrointestinal malabsorption or inflammatory bowel disease - History of heart problems such as: congestive heart failure (CHF), heart attack or high blood pressure.
